### Describe the feature you'd like:

Adding support for [asymmetricMatchers](https://github.com/facebook/jest/blob/151c961b13ca664e31fd52e87d9939e546ab46f3/packages/expect/src/asymmetricMatchers.ts) like [expec.stringContaining](https://jestjs.io/docs/en/expect#expectstringcontainingstring) as the value to `toHaveAttribute` matcher
Eg: 
```js

      expect(getByLabelText(/Download Template/)).toHaveAttribute(
        "href",
        expect.stringContaining("?type=instruments")
      );

```

<!--
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. Add any considered
drawbacks.
-->

<!-- Helpful but optional ðŸ˜€ -->

### Describe alternatives you've considered:

As of now this is achived by 

```js

      expect(getByLabelText(/Download Template/).getAttribute("href")).toEqual(
        expect.stringContaining("type=instruments")
      );

```
